name: Testing dir_reduc function
description:
Test a function dir_reduc which will take an array of
        strings and returns an array of strings with the needless
        directions removed (W<->E or S<->N side by side).

        The Haskell version takes a list of directions with
        data Direction = North | East | West | South.

        The Clojure version returns nil when the path is
        reduced to nothing.

        The Rust version takes a slice of enum Direction
        {NORTH, SOUTH, EAST, WEST}.
        :return:
descriptionHtml:
Codewars badge:

Test Description:

Test a function dirReduc which will take an array of strings and returns an array of strings with the needless directions removed (W<->E or S<->N side by side).

testStage.description:
Test a function dir_reduc which will take an array of
        strings and returns an array of strings with the needless
        directions removed (W<->E or S<->N side by side).

        The Haskell version takes a list of directions with

        The Rust version takes a slice of enum Direction

Codewars badge:

Test Description:

Test a function dirReduc which will take an array of strings and returns an array of strings with the needless directions removed (W<->E or S<->N side by side).

steps.name: Enter test data (['NORTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'EAST', 'WEST', 'NORTH', 'WEST']) and verify the output (['WEST']) vs expected (['WEST'])
Enter test data (['NORTH', 'WEST', 'SOUTH', 'EAST']) and verify the output (['NORTH', 'WEST', 'SOUTH', 'EAST']) vs expected (['NORTH', 'WEST', 'SOUTH', 'EAST'])
Enter test data (['NORTH', 'EAST', 'NORTH', 'EAST', 'WEST', 'WEST', 'EAST', 'EAST', 'WEST', 'SOUTH']) and verify the output (['NORTH', 'EAST']) vs expected (['NORTH', 'EAST'])

Enter test data (['EAST', 'NORTH', 'SOUTH', 'NORTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'NORTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'EAST', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'NORTH', 'NORTH', 'SOUTH', 'WEST', 'NORTH', 'EAST', 'WEST', 'WEST', 'WEST', 'EAST', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH']) and verify the output (['EAST', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'EAST', 'SOUTH', 'WEST', 'NORTH', 'WEST', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH']) vs expected (['EAST', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH', 'EAST', 'SOUTH', 'WEST', 'NORTH', 'WEST', 'SOUTH', 'SOUTH'])

Enter test data (['WEST', 'NORTH', 'EAST', 'EAST', 'EAST', 'EAST', 'WEST', 'WEST', 'WEST', 'WEST', 'NORTH', 'NORTH', 'SOUTH', 'EAST']) and verify the output (['WEST', 'NORTH', 'NORTH', 'EAST']) vs expected (['WEST', 'NORTH', 'NORTH', 'EAST'])
